title: WeWork accepts SoftBank bailout plan valuing WeWork at $8 bn: source
text:
New York (AFP) – Japan-based SoftBank will take control of WeWork in a bailout plan that will see the office-sharing startup’s co-founder Adam Neumann exit the board, a person close to the matter said Tuesday.

SoftBank, which already holds 29 percent of WeWork, will invest at least $5 billion more, the source said. About $1.7 billion will go to Neumann, who will step down.

The deal values WeWork at about $8 billion, a far cry from the $47 billion at the start of the year and a fraction of the sum envisioned in an initial public offering that was abandoned last month.
